message: Did anyone find an alternative?
I gave Plurk a try, and that worked out briefly, but otherwise was a bit lost after Pownce. I finally joined Facebook and Twitter after suggestions from real life connections.
@bastienlabelle I like Path too for private sharing
twitter mostly, a little facebook, but overall I just share less.
@schrodingercat same here, if my friends are going to see it, it's because i've shared it on fb...
Also, I think Facebook has been really inspired by Pownce after it shuts down. You know, lists, privacy, etc. Pownce was Facebook without crap!
@bastienlabelle I don't have enough tech-y friends to share it with. haha
@bastienlabelle I'll definitely have to try Path out now. I really care for the privacy aspect of the idea.
@leah yeah, the UI is gorgeous
Just signed up for Path but can't get pull up the iOS app in the App Store right now for some reason. Do any of you know if it's designed with the iPad in mind as well?
I recently tried out Path and so far it's pretty much like Pownce's photo/video sharing feature: privacy, comments, and great UI.
@schrodingercat they did a few days ago. it's pretty much like instagram, but I like the "close friends only" usage, i think it's pretty smart.

@schrodingercat I dont know in the US, but in France a lot of people have an iPhone, so you just have to convince your friends to install the free app, you setup the push notifications, and you're good to go :)
@bastienlabelle They added comments? It seemed identical to Instagram to me...
@michaelschade as far as I know, it's designed for iPhone only, maybe an iPad version is on their roadmap. can't tell.
I cried myself to sleep every night wearing my Pownce t-shirt.
But seriously, I went Twitter/Facebook
i don't like the bloat of facebook and sometimes find twitter lacking
Mostly twitter for me. I'm liking diaspora but we need more people in there.
Been using Diaspora but has not really taken off. Other than that Twitter
I now use a combination of Twitter and CloudApp ( getcloudapp.com ) to accomplish the perfect pownce-like file and image sharing.
I also really wanted LeafyChat to come alive, but I'm guessing the work done on that is here now?
@bastienlabelle Thanks, I'll have to keep an eye out until then. The iPhone apps on the iPad, scaled up, just don't do it.
This group just reminds me how much I miss Pownce...
Whiskey.
pownce was a good balance of features, kind of half way between twitter and facebook
I went to nothing ... then I got into Facebook because, well, I had to, since everyone else did. Then at some point I joined Twitter, too. Then I quit and restarted my account about thrice :)
I have high hopes for this place, it's like IRC but it feels better
The hilarious part is that I advertised the crap out of Pownce as an amazing replacement for Facebook, had a group of friends switch over, and then it shut down a month later. Sad times.
@thisisroby is right, this is making me miss it
http://crenk.com/wp-content/uploads/2008/12/pownce-logo.gif RULES!
i just use twitter but i kinda miss pownce i think it could have been like an underground twitter
Using twitter since Pownce closed.    It was the memory of Pownce that made me suspect convore could be elegant (not usually going after the latest trends...)
pownce was uber cool. for some reason it didn't caught traction on my friend network and i think i was the only one using it :(
Twitter 100%
Used Facebook for a few months too, though much less than Twitter.  Tired of it, closed account in December...
Wondering about a frenzy of group hoarding, given the nice URLs one gets here...
(a la DNS)
Twitter but nothing completely filled that void.
this site is COOL. i like it
@gggritso yes it is.

I loved Pownce—I remember being the most excited about the iPhone developer program almost solely because I was hoping for an iPhone-native Pownce client. I even tried to write one of my own… nothing that came after felt quite the same. Except maybe this, now?

i mostly use twitter and facebook.. i havent really found a good replacement.. i was going to use tumblr but never really got into it... i mostly use ping.fm to post to every social network that it can post to
I created additional Twitter accounts, some private. And used them in combination w/file hosting sites. Later I "got" Tumblr better, its multimedia dashboard stream is not unlike Pownce.
I had connection history in pownce... some milestones just get washed away.

I think I pretty much moved exclusively to Twitter. Too many old high school friends and family on Facebook for me to really be myself there and the other services like Diaspora, etc, never really could become a habit. Not like Pownce. I would go running to my computer some mornings and log in. I could never figure out why there wasn't more widespread appeal to it...
I started using Twitter hardcore. Facebook's changes signaled that it was the wrong direction for me, but Twitter just got simpler. I use Path/Tumblr for other sharing.
I'm now split betwee Twitter, Plurk, and Facebook Groups.
@rkalajian PLURK!!! Wow, thank you for the flashback!
Twitter, then a bit of Vox. Nothing quite did it for me like pownce though.
Twitter.
I tried pibb for a while too...
https://pibb.com/go/georgegeorgalis
after pownce i actually started using my twitter account
Twitter. For a few people, Facebook.
twitter, although with it's 1-way follow model it's not the same. It's less conversational and more a stream of unrelated thoughts.
thats very true
I remember posting to fb something like "why use facebook when there's Pownce?" Sad it closed down.
